metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Understand 07 02

config.question: What was Madison’s major criticism of the Report on Manufactures?

choices.content: It did not outline specific ways of reducing the dependence on European imports.
It would lead to the formation of ghettos.
It yielded too much power to the federal government.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Both Madison and Jefferson attacked the Report on Manufactures. Jefferson assumed—largely because Europe’s urban poverty had horrified him—that cities breed vice. The government, Jefferson argued, should not promote their development. He believed that Hamilton’s proposal guaranteed that American workers would leave the countryside and crowd into urban centers. See L.O. 7.2 Why did many Americans oppose Alexander Hamilton’s blueprint for national prosperity?
